bug.author: qraleq
bug.summary: Problem with setting up "Caching Docker Image on an EBS Volume"
bug.description: Hi, I set up everything according to the instructions related to "Caching Docker Image on an EBS Volume", and everything worked perfectly in the previous version of Spotty, but now in 1.3.0 I have problems starting an instance using the same settings. Spotty throws the following error: Validation error: The "mountDir" of one of the volumes must be a prefix for the "dockerDataRoot" path. Can you please help me resolve this?

comments.comment: Thank you, Ivan. It's a bug. A quick workaround would be to explicitly specify mount directories for the rest of the instance volumes. For example: <denchmark-code>... dockerDataRoot: /docker volumes: - name: project parameters: size: 20 mountDir: /mnt/project - name: data parameters: size: 500 mountDir: /mnt/data - name: docker parameters: size: 10 mountDir: /docker </denchmark-code>
